Context:
Program Name: Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management)
Code: T312
Credential: Honours Bachelor's Degree
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 4 years (1 field placement semester)
Starting Months: September
Domestic Tuition: $9,538.00 *
International Tuition: $21,045.00 **
Centre: Construction & Engineering Technologies
School: Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management
Location: Casa Loma Campus
Experiential Learning: Mandatory Field Experience
Program Description: Ontario’s first internationally accredited four-year degree specializing in construction management. Eligible for a $1000 entrance scholarship.
Program Duration and Availability: 4 years, starting in September with mandatory field experience. Domestic and international students can apply for Fall 2024 and Winter 2025.
Tuition Fees: Domestic - $9,538.00, International - $21,045.00 per year.
* Domestic tuition fee may be subject to change.
** International tuition fee is an estimate and may vary.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Honours Bachelor of Technology Program (Construction Management) T312 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) program is a recognized and fully accredited construction management degree offered by the Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management at the college. The degree requires students to complete a mandatory field experience semester, either through the Field Experience course or Prior Learning Assessment Recognition (PLAR), for a minimum of 450 hours of relevant experience in the construction management industry. Graduates may pursue various career options within the construction industry, including roles as construction managers, project managers, estimators, site superintendents, and many more. The program is accredited by the Canadian Institute of Quantity Surveyors (CIQS) and graduates qualify for Gold Seal Certification offered by the Canadian Construction Association (CCA).

Key Information:
- Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) degree
- Mandatory field experience semester (minimum 450 hours)
- Offered through Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management
- Recognized and fully accredited by CIQS
- Graduates qualify for Gold Seal Certification from CCA
- Career options: construction manager, project manager, estimator, site superintendent, etc.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Honours Bachelor of Technology Program (Construction Management) T312 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context: The Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) program is fully accredited by the Canadian Institute of Quantity Surveyors (CIQS). graduates are qualified to obtain professional memberships in various construction management associations, such as CIQS, and can apply for Professional Quantity Surveyors (PQS) or Construction Estimator Certified (CEC) designations. Additionally, graduates qualify for the Gold Seal Certification offered by the Canadian Construction Association (CCA), which is available for superintendents, forepeople, estimators, project managers, owner’s construction managers, and safety practitioners. The degree program is well respected in the construction sector.

Context:
The text discusses the importance of a four-year degree program in Construction Management at George Brown College according to several construction industry executives. They believe that having graduates with construction-specific skills will help meet the industry's continual requirement for construction professionals and strengthen the long-term success of the industry. Graduates of the Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) program can pursue graduate studies in relevant fields. They need to directly contact universities to explore what qualified graduate school opportunities exist.

Context: The graduate of this construction management program is expected to be able to use relevant media for communication, analyze past project performance, manage projects safely and ethically, apply various management tools and techniques, value diversity, develop teams, manage people in the construction industry, analyze technical problems, apply business principles, evaluate risks, create technical documents, and behave ethically. Domestic tuition for the first two semesters of the program starting in Fall 2023 is $9,538, international tuition is $21,045, and additional costs are estimated at $X for the first two semester but are subject to change. The fees do not include books or the cost of a field placement for international students. Financial assistance is available under the OS program.

Context:
Program: This program is approved for OSAP funding. It is an applied degree program, and the name of the school offering it is the Angelo DelZotto School (no specific name of the program is mentioned in the text).

Financial Assistance: The program is approved for OSAP funding.

Admission Requirements: Applicants need an Ontario Secondary School Diploma with six grade 12 University (U) or University/College (M) courses, including grade 12 (U) English and any grade 12 (U) Mathematics. A minimum grade of 60% in English and Math is required, along with an overall average of 65% in six grade 12 (U) or (M) courses. Mature students can apply if they are 19 years old or above and have no OSSD. In this case, they need to have grade 12 (U) English and Mathematics and a grade of 65% or higher in English and Math. Post-secondary courses in English and Mathematics will be considered for mature applicants.

English Language Proficiency: George Brown College ESL Level 9, TOEFL 84 overall with 21 in each skill band (Online), IELTS 6.5 overall with 6.0 in each skill band, MELAB 85, or CAEL overall 70 (writing 60) is required for proficiency in English communication.

International Students: More information can be found on the International Admissions page regarding country-specific admission requirements.

Duration of Consent: The college has been granted a consent by the Ministry of Colleges and Universities to offer this applied degree for a seven-year term starting May 7, 2018.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Honours Bachelor of Technology Program (Construction Management) T312 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The Angelo DelZotto School of Construction Management at George Brown College has the following admission requirements for students:

1. Recommendation of owning or purchasing a laptop and arranging for home Internet service with 25 to 40 Mbps and a ping time of 20–100 ms.
2. Laptop specifications:
   - Operating system: Windows 10 Home 64-bit English
   - Processor: 9th Generation Intel® Core™ i7-9750H (12MB Cache, up to 4.5 GHz, 6 cores)
   - Memory (RAM): 16GB (2x8GB DDR4 2666MHz)
   - Disk space: 256GB M.2 PCIe NVMe Solid State Drive (Boot) + 1TB 5400 rpm 2.5" SATA hard drive (Storage)
   - Display card: NVIDIA® GeForce RTX™ 2060 6GB GDDR6
   - Connectivity: 802.11ac WiFi and Bluetooth, 2 x 2
   - Ports: 1x HDMI 2.0; 3x SuperSpeed USB 3.1 Gen 1 Type-A including 1x with PowerShare; 1x 2-in-1 SD / MicroMedia Card slot; 1x Wedge lock slot
   - Screen size: minimum 15.6 inch FHD(1920 x 1080) 300nits IPS Anti-Glare LED Backlit display with 144Hz refresh rate
   - Audio: 1 combo headphone / microphone jack
3. Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges.
4. International Students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
5. Contact Information:
   - Phone: 416-415-5000, ext. 6297
   - Email: construction_degree@georgebrown.ca
   - Office hours: 8 a.m. – 4 p.m., room E228
6. The Centre for Construction and Engineering Technologies (CCET) Industry Liaison Office (ILO) hosts open houses typically in the autumn and spring. For more information visit the Construction and Engineering Open House page.
7. General information about George Brown College can be obtained by calling the Contact Centre at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002.
